Enumeration Type Documentation

enum rbx_PodAction
 

Pod Actions.

Enumeration values:
rbxRobotAction_IDLE  Pod is idle.
rbxRobotAction_WORKING  Pod is busy.
rbxRobotAction_STOPPING  Pod is stopping (from Working to Idle).

Function Documentation

int rbxPod_getUsbor (  int  podHandle,
int *  usborHandle
) 
 

Gets a handle to the Pod's parent Usbor.

Parameters:
[in] podHandle a handle to the Pod
[out] usborHandle pointer to an int that receives the handle of the parent Usbor
Returns:
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid

generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxPod_getName (  int  podHandle,
char *  podName,
int  maxLen,
int *  retLen
) 
 

Gets a Pod's name.

Parameters:
[in] podHandle a handle to the Pod
[out] podName pointer to a user buffer that receives the string; or NULL to get the required buffer length
[in] maxLen length of user buffer
[out] retLen pointer to an int that receives the actual number of characters copied or the required buffer length (if user buffer is NULL);
this paramater can be NULL only if the user buffer is not NULL;
Returns:
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes
See also:
Fetching Strings

int rbxPod_getPropertyHeartbeatTick (  int  podHandle,
int *  tick
) 
 

Gets a Pod's 'property heartbeat' tick.

This number is incremented every time a property heartbeat is received, even if the heartbeat does not contain any new data. Property heartbeats carry servo data, digout data, and the Pod's 'pause' state.

Parameters:
[in] podHandle a handle to the Pod
[out] tick pointer to a rbx_PodAction that receives the property heartbeat tick
Returns:
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes
See also:
rbxUsbor_getPropertyHeartbeatInterval()

int rbxPod_getSensorHeartbeatTick (  int  podHandle,
int *  tick
) 
 

Gets a Pod's 'sensor heartbeat' tick.

This number is incremented every time a sensor heartbeat is received, even if the heartbeat does not contain any new data. Sensor heartbeats carry only sensor data.

Parameters:
[in] podHandle a handle to the Pod
[out] tick pointer to a rbx_PodAction that receives the sensor heartbeat tick
Returns:
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes
See also:
rbxUsbor_getSensorHeartbeatInterval()

Returns:
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid

int rbxPod_isPaused (  int  podHandle,
int *  paused
) 
 

Determines if a Pod is currently in the 'paused' state.

Parameters:
[in] podHandle a handle to the Pod
[out] paused pointer to an int that receives the 'paused' status:
non-zero if paused; zero if not paused
Returns:
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxPod_powerAllServos (  int  podHandle,
int  power
) 
 

Sets power for all of a Pod's servos.

Parameters:
[in] podHandle a handle to the Pod
[in] power non-zero to power servos on; zero to power servos off
Returns:
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxPod_runQuickScript (  int  podHandle,
const char *  scriptText,
int *  seq
) 
 

Executes the specified quick script (aka immediate script).

Note:
Quick scripts are intended to be small and short-lived.
Parameters:
[in] podHandle a handle to the Pod
[in] scriptText the script to execute
[out] seq a pointer to an int that receives the sequence number (aka tracking number) associated with this Pod command;
may be NULL
Returns:
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes
See also:
rbxPod_isPodCmdStarted, rbxPod_isPodCmdFinished

int rbxPod_runQuickScriptEx (  int  podHandle,
const char *  scriptText,
const char *  scriptName,
int *  seq
) 
 

Executes the specified quick script (aka immediate script).

This function allows a name to be associated with the script.

Note:
Quick scripts are intended to be small and short-lived.
Parameters:
[in] podHandle a handle to the Pod
[in] scriptText the script to execute
[in] scriptName the script's name
[out] seq a pointer to an int that receives the sequence number (aka tracking number) associated with this Pod command;
may be NULL
Returns:
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes
See also:
rbxPod_isPodCmdStarted, rbxPod_isPodCmdFinished

int rbxPod_assignMainScript (  int  podHandle,
const char *  scriptText,
const char *  scriptName,
int *  seq
) 
 

Assigns the specified script to a Pod.

Note:
Assigning main scripts, and then running macros or lines is the preferred strategy for large, long-lived scripts.
Parameters:
[in] podHandle a handle to the Pod
[in] scriptText the script to execute
[in] scriptName the script's name
[out] seq a pointer to an int that receives the sequence number (aka tracking number) associated with this Pod command;
may be NULL
Returns:
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes
See also:
rbxPod_isPodCmdStarted, rbxPod_isPodCmdFinished

int rbxPod_assignMainScriptFromFile (  int  podHandle,
const char *  filename,
int *  seq
) 
 

Reads a Pod script from the specified file and assigns the script to a Pod.

Parameters:
[in] podHandle a handle to the Pod
[in] filename filename of the Pod script
[out] seq a pointer to an int that receives the sequence number (aka tracking number) associated with this Pod command;
may be NULL
Returns:
RBX_E_FILE_NOT_FOUND if the file does not exist or could not be opened for reading
RBX_E_IO_ERROR if an I/O error occurred
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes
See also:
rbxPod_isPodCmdStarted, rbxPod_isPodCmdFinished

int rbxPod_runMainLines (  int  podHandle,
int  startLine,
int  endLine,
int *  seq
) 
 

Executes a set of lines in a Pod's currently-assigned main script.

All lines between, and including, startLine and endLine will be executed. Newline characters ('\n') in the script are used as line separators.

Parameters:
[in] podHandle a handle to the Pod
[in] startLine the first line to execute
[in] endLine the last line to execute
[out] seq a pointer to an int that receives the sequence number (aka tracking number) associated with this Pod command;
may be NULL
Returns:
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes
See also:
rbxPod_isPodCmdStarted, rbxPod_isPodCmdFinished

int rbxPod_runMainMacro (  int  podHandle,
const char *  macroName,
int  iterations,
int *  seq
) 
 

Executes the specified macro in a Pod's currently-assigned main script.

Parameters:
[in] podHandle a handle to the Pod
[in] macroName the macro's name
[in] iterations the number of times to execute the macro;
0 for infinite
[out] seq a pointer to an int that receives the sequence number (aka tracking number) associated with this Pod command;
may be NULL
Returns:
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes
See also:
rbxPod_isPodCmdStarted, rbxPod_isPodCmdFinished

int rbxPod_runTeachCommand (  int  podHandle,
const char *  teachCommand
) 
 

Executes a one-line script command.

Warning:
This method is intended for use by "user teach mode" type applications. General use of this method is strongly discouraged.
Parameters:
[in] podHandle a handle to the Pod
[in] teachCommand the command to execute
Returns:
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxPod_isPodCmdStarted (  int  podHandle,
int  seq,
int *  started
) 
 

Determines if the Pod command with the specified sequence number has started executing.

This method is useful because Pod commands (assigning main scripts, running quick scripts, etc.) may not execute immediately. They are sent to a remote Nexus where they may be queued before execution.

Parameters:
[in] podHandle a handle to the Pod
[in] seq the sequence number (aka tracking number) to test
[out] started pointer to an int that receives the 'started' status:
non-zero if command has started; zero if command has not started
Returns:
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxPod_isPodCmdFinished (  int  podHandle,
int  seq,
int *  finished
) 
 

Determines if the Pod command with the specified sequence number has finished executing.

Parameters:
[in] podHandle a handle to the Pod
[in] seq the sequence number (aka tracking number) to test
[out] finished pointer to an int that receives the 'finished' status:
non-zero if command has finished; zero if command has not finished
Returns:
RBX_E_POD_HANDLE_INVALID if the specified Pod handle is invalid
generic Robix Error Codes
